node.Title: A New AWS Region Opens in Switzerland
node.Description: I am pleased to announce today the opening of our 28th AWS Region: Europe (Zurich), also known by its API name: eu-central-2. An AWS Region allows you to deploy your most demanding workloads and replicate your applications and data across distinct groups of data centers called Availability Zones. This new Region has three fully redundant […]

node.Title: Hashgraph: The sustainable alternative to blockchain
node.Description:
When most people talk about Web3 or cryptocurrencies and related technologies, they usually mean blockchains. But blockchain is only the first generation of distributed ledger technology (DLT). As with any new technology, once people see how it works, new generations come along rapidly to address the faults in the previous ones.  On this sponsored episode…

node.Title: How to Be a Great Friend With Evernote
node.Description:
When you’re a kid, making friends is easy. You like kickball? I like kickball! The bond is instant and unbreakable. You see your friends at school every weekday, and you know everything about them because you’re always together. node.Title: Career stories: From Hollywood videographer to frontend engineer
node.Description: Originally an LA-based videographer and self-taught developer, Kiope wanted to turn her hobby into a career. Following a coding bootcamp and a stint at a startup, she joined LinkedIn as a frontend (UI) engineer. Based in San Francisco, Kiope speaks about her meaningful accessibility work, impact at scale, and career growth as an aspiring manager. After my undergrad degree in film studies, I jetted off to Los Angeles to start my career in Hollywood as a talent agency assistant. node.Title: 10 Tips to Boost Your Writing Productivity
node.Description:
Writing isn’t always easy. Some days, you might be extremely productive, while on others, you don’t get as many words on the page as you had hoped. Whether you’re writing a novel, maintaining a blog, or keeping a journal, the answers to these problems are mostly the same.  Writing is like exercise: adopt a sensible training regimen, apply it consistently, and you’ll grow stronger. But it’s also like meditation: open
